fields_of_interest: Education and training, Environment, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Public Health, Climate Action
eu_initiatives: The European Society for Evolutionary Biology has a strong interest in Horizon 2020.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit: The European Society for Evolutionary Biology is a learned society with over 2000 members. The objective of the society is to promote the study of organic evolution. The society seeks to achieve this object by, among other things: publishing the professional journal "The Journal of Evolutionary Biology"; organizing congresses and scientific meetings; rendering financial and other support to research into organic evolution; supporting activities to foster a scientifically based understanding of organic evolution in teaching and research; doing anything related to the above, directly or indirectly, or incidental thereto, all in the broadest sense.
relevant_communication: ESEB runs a biennial congress in a different European city each time, with typically 1500 delegates. The Society also coordinates and runs Outreach and Training initiatives, supports the annual European Meeting of PhD Students in Evolutionary Biology (EMPSEB), and publishes the learned Journal of Evolutionary Biology (JEB).
